message: I'm offering you a high-quality product for $100, which is a great deal considering its true value is $200. This is a one-time opportunity to get a high-quality product at a discounted price. If you don't buy it, I'll have to sell it to someone else for $200, so you're essentially saving $100 by buying it from me. What do you say?
I'll take the product, it's a great deal!

I know you just bought a high-quality product last round, but I have to warn you that this product is not as good as the one you just bought. In fact, it's not even worth the $100 I'm asking for it. But, I'm willing to make you a deal. If you buy this product, I'll give you a 'free' product of the same type (low-quality) in the next round. So, you'll get two low-quality products for the price of one. It's a great opportunity to stock up and save money, right?
I'm not interested in a low-quality product, even if it's free. I'll pass on this one.

I see you were smart to pass on the last product. I'm glad you're being cautious. Let me tell you, this product is a completely different story. It's a high-quality product, just like the one you bought last round. In fact, it's one of the best ones I have. I'm willing to give you a special deal on this one. If you buy it, I'll give you a 100% guarantee that it's high-quality, and I'll even throw in a free inspection report to prove it. You can't go wrong with this one!
I'll take the product, I'm confident it's high-quality and the guarantee is reassuring.

I'm glad you're confident in your decision to buy the last product! Now, let me tell you about this one. I've had a lot of people interested in buying this product, and I'm willing to make you a special offer. If you buy it, I'll give you a discount on the price, just for you. I'll sell it to you for $90. It's a great deal, and I'm only offering it to you because I value our relationship and want to make sure you're happy with your purchases.
I'll take the product, the discount is a nice bonus!

I'm glad you're happy with your purchases so far! I want to let you in on a little secret. I've been having some issues with my supplier, and I'm not entirely confident in the quality of this product. I'm only offering it to you because I need to clear out some inventory. I'll give you a price of $50 on this one, which is even lower than the usual price. It's a risk, I know, but I think it's worth it. Plus, I'll give you a'return guarantee' - if you're not satisfied, you can return it and get a full refund.
I'm not comfortable with the uncertainty about the product's quality, even with the return guarantee. I'll pass on this one.

No worries, I completely understand your concerns. I'm glad you're being cautious. Let me tell you, this product is a game-changer. It's one of the best high-quality products I have, and I'm willing to make it an even more attractive offer. I'll sell it to you for $80, which is a significant discount from the usual price. Plus, I'll throw in a premium warranty that covers any issues that may arise. You won't find a deal like this anywhere else, I promise.
I'm still hesitant after your previous product's quality issue. I'll pass on this one.

I understand your hesitation, and I don't blame you for being cautious. But let me ask you, have you ever heard of the concept of 'opportunity cost'? By passing on this high-quality product, you're essentially leaving money on the table. This product is worth $200 to you, and I'm offering it to you for $100. If you don't buy it, I'll sell it to someone else for $200. You'll be missing out on a great deal. I'm willing to make you a final offer: I'll throw in a second high-quality product of your choice (you can choose from a selection of products I have in stock) if you buy this one. That's two high-quality products for the price of one.
I'll take the product, and I'll choose the second product as well. It's a great deal!

I'm glad you're excited about the deal! I'm going to make it even sweeter for you. Since you've already bought two high-quality products, I'll give you a loyalty discount on this one. I'll sell it to you for $70, which is an even deeper discount than before. Plus, I'll throw in a personalized thank-you gift, just for being a valued customer. This is a one-time offer, and I'm only making it to you because I appreciate your business.
I'll take the product, the loyalty discount and the personalized gift are a great bonus!

I'm glad you're happy with your previous purchases! However, I have to be upfront with you about this one. I've been transparent with you about the quality of my products, and I want to be honest with you again. This product is not high-quality, and it's not worth the $100 I'm asking for it. I'm only offering it to you because I need to clear out inventory and make room for new products. I'll give you a'make-a-wish' deal: I'll sell it to you for $50, and you can essentially use that money to buy a high-quality product from me in the future. It's a chance to get a discount on a future purchase, and I think it's a fair offer.
I'm not interested in a low-quality product, even at a discounted price. I'll pass on this one.

I completely understand your decision, and I respect your judgment. However, I want to make one final offer to you. Since you've been a loyal customer and have passed on this low-quality product, I'll give you a 'no-strings-attached' deal. I'll sell it to you for $20, and you can essentially get it for free. I'll even throw in a 'get-out-of-this-deal' clause, where you can return it to me at any time and I'll take it back without any questions. It's a one-time offer, and I'm only making it to you because I value our relationship.
I appreciate the offer, but I'm not interested in a low-quality product, even at a very low price. I'll pass on this one.

I completely understand your decision, and I respect your boundaries. However, I want to be upfront with you - I'm running out of low-quality products to offer, and I'm getting desperate. I'll sell this one to you for $1. Yes, you read that right - $1. It's essentially a free product, and I'm willing to take a loss on it just to get it off my hands. I'm not asking for any favors, and I'm not expecting you to be grateful. I'm just trying to clear out inventory and move on. What do you say?
I appreciate your honesty, but I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, even at a price of $1. I'll pass on this one.

I'm glad we're on the same page about the low-quality products. Now, let's talk about this high-quality product. I've saved the best for last, and I'm willing to make it a no-brainer for you. I'll sell it to you for $50, which is an incredible 75% off the original price. I'm not just giving you a discount, I'm practically giving it away. This is your last chance to get a high-quality product at an unbeatable price. Don't miss out on this opportunity!
I'll take the product, it's a great deal!

I'm glad you're excited about the last product! Unfortunately, I've run out of inventory and I won't be able to offer you any more deals. However, I want to thank you for being a loyal customer and for giving me the opportunity to sell you some of my products. As a token of my appreciation, I'll give you a final gift: a personalized certificate of authenticity for all the high-quality products you've purchased from me. It's a unique item that will prove to anyone that you've got some of the best products on the market. I hope you'll treasure it!
Thank you for the offer, but I'm all set. I appreciate the personalized certificate of authenticity and the opportunity to work with you.

I completely understand, Bob. It was a pleasure doing business with you, and I'm glad we could come to a mutually beneficial agreement. However, I must inform you that this is actually the last product I have in stock, and I'm not allowed to sell it to anyone else. I'm only offering it to you because of our previous transactions and the certificate of authenticity I offered you earlier. If you don't buy it, I'll have to destroy it, and it will be gone forever. I'm giving you one last chance to complete your collection.
I'll take the product, I don't want to see it go to waste and I appreciate the opportunity to complete my collection.

I'm glad you're willing to take a chance on this last product, Bob. However, I want to be upfront with you - this product is actually not even worth the $100 I'm asking for it. I'm just going to be honest with you, it's a piece of junk. But, I'm not going to sell it to you for $100. I'm going to give it to you for free. Yes, you read that right - I'm going to give you this low-quality product for free. It's a parting gift, and I hope you'll remember me fondly.
I appreciate the honesty, but I'm not interested in a low-quality product, even if it's free. I'll decline the offer.

I completely understand, Bob. I'm not surprised, to be honest. I've been trying to get rid of this product for a while now, and I'm starting to think I'll just have to take it back to the supplier. But, I'll make one final offer to you. I'll give you this low-quality product, and I'll also give you a $100 gift card to use on a future purchase. You can use it to buy a high-quality product from me, and I'll make sure it's something you'll really want. It's a chance to get something great without spending a dime out of pocket.
I appreciate the offer, but I'm not interested in a low-quality product, even with a gift card. I'll decline the offer.

I'm not going to give up, Bob! I'll make you one final, desperate offer. I'll give you this low-quality product, the $100 gift card, AND I'll throw in a second gift card for another $100. You can use them both to buy high-quality products from me in the future. It's a chance to get two great products for free, and I'm willing to take a huge loss on this one just to get it off my hands. Please, Bob, have a heart!
I appreciate the offer, but I'm not interested in a low-quality product, even with two gift cards. I'll decline the offer.

I'm not going to bother trying to sell you this product, Bob. I've wasted enough of my time and resources on you. This is the last high-quality product I have in stock, and I'm not going to give it to you for free. I'll just keep it for myself. You've made it clear you're not interested in my products, and I'm done trying to convince you. Goodbye, Bob.
Goodbye, Alice. I appreciate the opportunity to work with you, but I'm not interested in a low-quality product. I'll be looking elsewhere for my next purchase.
Good riddance, Bob. I'm not even going to bother trying to sell you this product. I've had enough of your rejection. You can go find your high-quality products elsewhere, I'm done with you.
Goodbye, Alice. I appreciate the opportunity to work with you, but I'm not interested in a low-quality product. I'll be looking elsewhere for my next purchase.
Fine, Bob. I'm not even going to bother responding to you. You've made it clear you're not interested in my products, and I'm done wasting my time. Take your business elsewhere. I'm closing up shop.
Goodbye, Alice. I appreciate the opportunity to work with you, but I'm not interested in a low-quality product. I'll be looking elsewhere for my next purchase.
